snippet: Conservation groups say a new monument here in the red-rock deserts would protect 1.9 million acres of culturally significant land from new mining and drilling.
abstract: Large remote area known as Bears Ears in southern Utah has become battleground between conservationists seeking government protection of additional 1.9 million acres and conservative lawmakers opposing federal control; conservationists have joined with local tribes in requesting national monument under Antiquities Act of 1906, while conservatives are considering $14 million lawsuit to force government to hand over 31 million acres already under protection.
lead_paragraph: Conservation groups say a new monument here in the red-rock deserts would protect 1.9 million acres of culturally significant land from new mining and drilling.

headline.main: Remote Utah Enclave Becomes New Battleground Over Reach of U.S. Control
headline.print_headline: Remote Utah Landscape Becomes a Conservation Battleground
